intro: Psychotria tetrapyrena, commonly known as the four-lobed Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with four distinct lobes, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests.
